intro: Sonerila mollissima, commonly known as the velvet sonerila, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are velvety to the touch, giving it its common name, and it produces clusters of small, fragrant blooms. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
